article.headline: Akron 87, Central Michigan 66
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- Derrick Tarver scored 30 points to lead Akron past Central Michigan 87-66 on Wednesday. The Zips (12-11, 6-9 Mid-American) grabbed a 48-34 halftime lead and pushed their lead to as many as 20 points early in the second half. A 3-pointer by Central Michigan's Kevin Nelson cut the deficit to 13 with 16:35 left in the game, but the Chippewas (4-20, 1-13) got no closer. The Zips had an 8-0 run, a 7-0 run and two 6-0 runs as they won their first conference road game of the season. Romeo Travis, a high school teammate of rookie NBA star LeBron James, scored 15 points for the Zips while Johnny Hollingsworth scored 12. Adam Dentlinger led Central Michigan with 13 points while Gerrit Brigitha scored 12, Nelson scored 11 and Tony Bowne scored 10. <
